children.value:
This machine learning course is created with Jupyter notebooks that allow you to interact with all the machine learning concepts
and algorithms to understand them better. At the same time, youâ€™ll learn how to control these algorithms and use them in practice.

Lectures can be viewed online as notebooks, as slides (online or PDF), or as videos (hosted on YouTube). They all have the same content.
Upon opening the notebooks, you can
launch them in Google Colab (or Binder), or run them locally.
These lectures (slides and video recordings) are being updated.
The order of the slides in the video is slightly different.

If you notice any issue, or have suggestions or requests, please go the
icon on top of the page and then 'open issue`. We also welcome pull requests :).
Download the lab notebooks and solve the questions locally, or launch them in Google Colab or Binder. Please review the relevant tutorials
starting the labs. Solutions will appear towards the end of each lab session.
General introductions into using Python for scientific programming and machine learning.
Lectures on both basic machine learning techniques (useful for novices to cover any knowledge gaps), as well as additional useful techniques that we couldnâ€™t fit into the schedule.
These resources help to further deepen your skills, and are well aligned with this course.
